page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: NUN MONKTON AND MOOR MONKTON WERE RECORDED IN DOMESDAY 1068. MONKTON IS FROM SAXON{MONCHETONE,}A MONASTERY OR HERMITAGE.NO EVIDENCE REMAINS IN MOOR MONKTON,BUT A BENEDICTINE PRIORY WAS FOUNDED IN NUN MONKTON IN THE 12TH CENTURY AND EXISTED UNTIL DISSOLUTION IN 1536.THE CHURCH STILL STANDS. THE HALL ON THE NUNNERY SITE IS STILL CALLED THE PRIORY. VESTIGES OF RIDGE AND FURROW PLOUGHING BEAR EVIDENCE OF MEDIEVAL OPEN FIELD AGRICULTURE. GLEBE LANDS IN MOOR MONKTON 1576 DEMISED TO BOURCHIER OF BENINGBROUGH INDICATE CLOSER LINKS THAN AT PRESENT.PASTURES ARE ENCLOSED BY OLD HEDGES.REMAINS OF A MOAT IN MOOR MONKTON MARK THE SITE OF A FORTIFIED MANOR. THIS VILLAGE DEVELOPED ON A GRID IRON PATTERN ALONG A VILLAGE STREET WHILE NUN MONKTON DEVELOPED ROUND A VILLAGE GREEN. BOTH WERE ESTATE VILLAGES.
